results.title: Becoming (2003)
results.brief_description: This work consists of 7 dual-channel installations. As viewers enter the exhibition space, they are faced by found footage of iconic performances delivered by seven popular Hollywood female leads and then paired with a version by Candice Breitz delivering the lines.

constellations_other.name: Sound and cinema
constellations_other.description: Beginning with one of the first films to be screened at the Palais (a Melbourne cinema with its own outstanding resident orchestra) the constellation celebrates sound as an integral part of the connection between moving image work and audience.

results.description:
Each actor’s lines of dialogue have been taken out of their narrative context, and the responses of the actors they play against have been eliminated. Each of these pieced-together performances is then paired with the Candice Breitz version of the same one-sided routine. Sharing the same soundtrack as the ‘original’, Breitz lipsyncs the same lines and uses the same gestures and expressions to produce a copy of the original.

This work consists of 7 dual-channel installations. As viewers enter the exhibition space, they are faced by found footage of iconic performances delivered by seven popular Hollywood female leads: Cameron Diaz, Julia Roberts, Jennifer Lopez, Meg Ryan, Neve Campbell, Reese Witherspoon and Drew Barrymore. On the reverse side of each of these screens, viewers will find an alternative performance delivered by the artist herself.
description_for_label:
Each actor’s lines of dialogue have been taken out of their narrative context, and the responses of the actors they play against have been eliminated. Each of these pieced-together performances is then paired with the Candice Breitz version of the same one-sided routine. Sharing the same soundtrack as the ‘original’, Breitz lipsyncs the same lines and uses the same gestures and expressions to produce a copy of the original.

This work consists of 7 dual-channel installations. As viewers enter the exhibition space, they are faced by found footage of iconic performances delivered by seven popular Hollywood female leads: Cameron Diaz, Julia Roberts, Jennifer Lopez, Meg Ryan, Neve Campbell, Reese Witherspoon and Drew Barrymore. On the reverse side of each of these screens, viewers will find an alternative performance delivered by the artist herself.

group_siblings.title: Miriam Hopkins, Rouben Mamoulian and film crew on the set of Becky Sharp

results.title: Becky Sharp
results.brief_description: Adapted from a play that drew inspiration from William Makepeace Thackeray’s novel “Vanity Fair”, the film explores the English class system during the era of the Napoleonic Wars, but more importantly, is the first feature to use three-strip Technicolor.

constellations_other.name: Over the Technicolor rainbow
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores the beginning and legacy of Technicolor and was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Adam Virgona and Kristian Vass.

constellations_other.name: Evolution of colour
constellations_other.description: From stenciling film frames through to the survival of Technicolor after Hollywood stopped using it, this Constellation links early cinema to some of the world's greatest films.

results.description: Adapted from a play that drew inspiration from William Makepeace Thackeray’s book “Vanity Fair”, the film looks at the English class system during the era of the Napoleonic Wars. It is noted for being the first feature film to use the three-strip Technicolor process.
description_for_label: Adapted from a play that drew inspiration from William Makepeace Thackeray’s book “Vanity Fair”, the film looks at the English class system during the era of the Napoleonic Wars. It is noted for being the first feature film to use the three-strip Technicolor process.

results.title: Becky
results.brief_description: This is the story of a retarded child and how her parents and others cope and learn from each other. Special ways of training at home and school are shown and the possible need for specialised medical care is touched upon. Such children can emerge from the special treatment area and enter normal life. This poignant and yet cheerful family portrait tells us how one family successfully copes with having their child at home. No other credits available.

results.title: Because They're Black
results.creator_credit: Rosemary Burden, Roy Wooding, South Australian Film Corporation and Education Dept, S A
results.brief_description: A series of revealing interviews with Aboriginal students show what pressures exist for them in a white racist society. Teachers, parents and teacher’s aides are also interviewed. A good discussion starter for all those involved in the education of Aboriginal students.

results.title: Bebert et L'omnibus = Bebert and the Bus
results.brief_description:
Bebert is a five-year-old boy who becomes separated from his older brother on a train. The precocious moppet observes the less-than-grown-up activities of the adults as he seeks to be reunited with his family.

Credits: Producer, Leon Carre ; director, Yves Robert ; writer, Francois Boyer ; photography, Andre Bac ; Music, Philippe Gerard ; musical direction, Francois Rauber ; editor, Andre and Monique Isnardon.
Cast: Petit Gibus, Blanchette Brunoy, Pierre Mondy, Jean Richard, Michel Serrault, Jacques Higelin, Jean Lefebvre, Tsilla Chelton, Sophie Grimaldi.

results.title: Beavis and Butt-head
results.creator_credit: Film Roman Productions, MTV Animation, J.J. Sedelmaier Productions, Paramount Television, Judgemental Films Inc., Tenth Annual Industries, Ternion Pictures and Mike Judge
results.brief_description: Beavis and Butt-head are high school students whose lifestyles revolve around TV, junk food (usually nachos), shopping malls, heavy metal music, and trying to “score with chicks”. Each show contains short cartoons centering on the duo who live in the fictitious town of Highland, Texas. The episodes are broken up by short breaks in which Beavis and Butt-head watch and make fun of music videos.

constellations_other.name: Horror movie right there on my TV
constellations_other.description: The colourful and quirky music video for Skyhooks’ song 'Horror Movie' helped propel them to number one, making it their biggest hit.

results.title: Beaver dam
results.creator_credit: F.R. Crawley, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film for children, one of its greatest appeal is watching the beaver at work, busily and cheerfully demonstrating the characteristics for which it is famous. Sometimes, however, a beaver’s industry runs counter to the plans of people. When the beaver’s dam floods their father’s hay field, two boys quickly devise a plan to save the beaver from their father’s displeasure.
